meanings.definition: The process of separating substances of different densities using centrifugal force.
meanings.sent1: During centrifugation, heavier particles move outward due to the spinning motion.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use centrifugation to separate blood components for analysis.
meanings.sent3: I tried to use centrifugation to separate my vegetables, but they all ended up mixed together.
meanings.sent4: The centrifugation of opinions in the meeting room led to a clear division between two sides.
meanings.sent5: The centrifugation of the paint mixture created beautiful layers of colors.

meanings.definition: The act of spinning a mixture at high speeds to separate its components.
meanings.sent1: After the centrifugation, the mixture was divided into distinct layers.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician performed centrifugation to isolate the DNA from the sample.
meanings.sent3: The centrifugation of the cake batter was so fast that it flew out of the bowl!
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts went through a mental centrifugation, sorting out the important from the trivial.
meanings.sent5: The centrifugation of the sand and water mixture revealed the heavier particles at the bottom.

meanings.definition: A method of separating particles based on their size and density through rapid rotation.
meanings.sent1: Centrifugation is commonly used in laboratories to separate cell components.
meanings.sent2: The centrifugation of the soil sample helped determine its composition.
meanings.sent3: The centrifugation of the toy box was like a whirlwind of toys flying around.
meanings.sent4: In the chaos of emotions, her mind felt like a centrifugation of conflicting feelings.
meanings.sent5: The centrifugation of the liquid revealed layers of different densities.
